intro: Geranium mexicanum var. macranthum, commonly known as the Mexican geranium, is a strikingly ornamental plant native to Mexico. It features showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with a distinctive dark eye at the center. The plant has heart-shaped, velvety leaves that are typically a deep green, adding visual interest to its overall appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and containers. Its compact growth habit and long blooming period make it a versatile and visually appealing addition to any landscape.
